questions.text: Are all your contact channels are enabled and routed based on availability or preferences?
Are customers able to self-serve through Lex bots or conversational IVR?
Do contact flows personalize experiences using CRM data, history, or context?
Are callback and queue management features actively used?
Is Contact Lens enabled for sentiment analysis, transcripts, and compliance monitoring?
Do agents use real-time AI assistance (Amazon Q in Connect) for guidance or knowledge?
Are your post-contact summaries and sentiment analysis integrated with your CRM?
Is automated contact categorization or tagging used to reduce manual work?
Are agents using the unified workspace (threaded views, screen pops, unified profiles)?
Do agents use screen recording and screen sharing appropriately?
Are tasks automated and managed via Amazon Connect Tasks?
Are you using agent evaluations?
Is Connect integrated with CRM, ticketing, WFM, or internal systems?
Are customer records or cases automatically updated using APIs/Lambdas?
Is contextual data passed into contact flows (identity, case history, app session info)?
Are automated workflows (Lambda/EventBridge/APIs) used to remove manual steps?
Do standard Connect reports meet your needs?
Do you have the ability to review historical interactions?
Is Lex bot performance evaluated regularly to improve containment and CX?
Are contact flow analytics reviewed often to identify friction and optimize journeys?
